repeater.note1: Please use standard browser - Edge, Chrome, Safari or Firefox to ensure PDJ Media Repeater can work correctly.
repeater.note2: For Android Phone in China, please use Official
repeater.note3: Other browsers may not support uttering translation lines with system TTS(will auto switch to online TTS service), or may hijack video or audio tag to make PDJ media repeater losing control of the media file.
repeater.utterSubtitle: Utter Subtitle's Translation Line with TTS
repeater.notSystemTTSnote: This default TTS API address maybe invalid. You can change it to any other online TTS API address (Test it firstly).
repeater.lineNumOfTrans: Line Number Of Translation In Subtitle:
repeater.autoPauseAfterUttering: AutoPause After Uttering Translation Line, And Click To Continue.
repeater.playFullFavList: Play All Favorite Sentenses in Current Folder When Playing Favorite List (In this mode, autoPlay current sentence is not allowed due to browser's restriction.)
repeater.instruction1: Click on the screen (DOWN arrow key on keyboard): replay current sentence
repeater.instruction2: DoubleClick on the screen (UP arrow key on keyboard): stop playing
repeater.instruction3: Swipe Left on the screen (RIGHT arrow key on keyboard): jump to next sentence
repeater.instruction4: Swipe Right on the screen(LEFT arrow key on keyboard): jump to previous sentence
repeater.instruction5: Swipe Up on the screen: add to favorites (Or remove a favorite when playing Favorite List)
repeater.instruction6: Swipe Down on the screen: close this player
repeater.instruction7: switch Playback Mode between 'Single Sentence Repetition Mode' and 'Regular Mode'
repeater.instruction9: show SETTINGS, INSTRUCTIONS, UPDATES and COMMENTS
repeater.instruction11: add or remove a favorite sentence.
repeater.instruction12: show current Sentence No. and switch to a special Sentence No.
repeater.learnLangUsingPDJ: To Learn A Language Using PDJ Media Repeater
repeater.learnLang1: There are two very effective methods to learn a language: Shadowing and Reciting. For shadowing, you need listen to a sentence firstly, and then repeat it yourself immediately (maybe in mind). For reciting, you need read or listen to a sentence in your mother language firstly, and then translate to the new language immediately.
repeater.learnLang2: The key to success is REPETITION. For the same sentence, you need to repeat shadowing and reciting it again and again (maybe 100 times in a year) to make it as familiar as your mother language. This is a boring and time-consuming job with no obvious effects in short time.
repeater.learnLang3: With PDJ Media Repeater, you can do shadowing and reciting easier. Just choose a video or audio with 20-50 sentences every week, and repeat shadowing and reciting them every morning and evening 2 or 3 times. You can lie in your bed, close your eyes, and click, or swipe left, up in your cell phone to learn the language. Thus, in one year, you may master thousands of sentences as fluent as your mother language. That will be a big improvement.
repeater.speechsynthesisAlert: Sorry, your browser does not support 'speechSynthesis API', and it can't utter the subtitle's translation line with system embedded TTS. You can use official Firefox browser in Android phone (especially in China), Safari in iPhone, and Chrome/Edge in windows PC
repeater.warning1: Video or audeo tag is hijacked by this browser. This browser does not fully comply with HTML5 standard. Please use standard browser: Edge, Chrome, Safari or Firefox to ensure PDJ Media Repeater can work correctly.

settings.allowEdit: Edit, rename and delete files or directories
settings.brandingHelp:
You can customize how your File Browser instance looks and feels by changing its name, replacing the logo, adding custom styles and even disable external links to GitHub.
For more information about custom branding, please check out the {0}.
settings.commandRunnerHelp: Here you can set commands that are executed in the named events. You must write one per line. The environment variables {0} and {1} will be available, being {0} relative to {1}. For more information about this feature and the available environment variables, please read the {2}.
settings.createUserDir: Auto create user home dir while adding new user
settings.tusUploadsHelp: File Browser supports chunked file uploads, allowing for the creation of efficient, reliable, resumable and chunked file uploads even on unreliable networks.
settings.tusUploadsChunkSize: Indicates to maximum size of a request (direct uploads will be used for smaller uploads). You may input a plain integer denoting byte size input or a string like 10MB, 1GB etc.
settings.tusUploadsRetryCount: Number of retries to perform if a chunk fails to upload.
settings.userHomeBasePath: Base path for user home directories
settings.userScopeGenerationPlaceholder: The scope will be auto generated
settings.defaultUserDescription: These are the default settings for new users.
settings.executeOnShellDescription: By default, File Browser executes the commands by calling their binaries directly. If you wish to run them on a shell instead (such as Bash or PowerShell), you can define it here with the required arguments and flags. If set, the command you execute will be appended as an argument. This applies to both user commands and event hooks.
settings.globalRules: This is a global set of allow and disallow rules. They apply to every user. You can define specific rules on each user's settings to override these ones.
settings.lockPassword: Prevent the user from changing the password

perm.rename: Rename or move files and directories

settings.permissionsHelp: You can set the user to be an administrator or choose the permissions individually. If you select "Administrator", all of the other options will be automatically checked. The management of users remains a privilege of an administrator.
settings.ruleExample1: prevents the access to any dotfile (such as .git, .gitignore) in every folder.
settings.ruleExample2: blocks the access to the file named Caddyfile on the root of the scope.
settings.rulesHelp: Here you can define a set of allow and disallow rules for this specific user. The blocked files won't show up in the listings and they wont be accessible to the user. We support regex and paths relative to the users scope.
settings.singleClick: Use single clicks to open files and directories
settings.userCommandsHelp: A space separated list with the available commands for this user. Example:
